metadata.description: Priority contextual phrases with full translations

phrases.usage_notes: Use when meeting someone for the first time in the morning, or in very formal situations
phrases.cultural_notes: In East African cultures, greetings are very important and should not be rushed

translations.arabic: صباح الخير يا صديقي! (sabah al-khayr ya sadiqi!)

phrases.usage_notes: Use with friends, close colleagues, or people you know well
phrases.cultural_notes: Can be shortened or made more casual among close friends

translations.arabic: صباح الخير يا حبيبي/حبيبتي (sabah al-khayr ya habibi/habibti)

phrases.usage_notes: Affectionate morning greeting from parent to child
phrases.cultural_notes: Terms of endearment vary by culture and family

translations.english: Hi honey/darling, how was your day?
translations.amharic: ሰላም ፍቅሬ፣ ቀንሽ እንዴት ነበር? (selam fiqre, qensh indet neber?)
translations.tigrinya: ሰላም ፍቕረይ፣ መዓልትኻ ከመይ ነበረ? (selam fiqrey, me'altika kemey nebere?)
translations.oromo: Akkam jirta jaalala koo, guyyaan kee akkam ture?
translations.arabic: مرحباً حبيبي/حبيبتي، كيف كان يومك؟ (marhaban habibi/habibti, kayfa kana yawmuk?)
translations.french: Salut mon amour, comment s'est passée ta journée?
translations.spanish: Hola mi amor, ¿cómo estuvo tu día?

phrases.usage_notes: Affectionate evening greeting between romantic partners
phrases.cultural_notes: Shows care and interest in partner's day

phrases.base_meaning: Can you help me? (formal, to stranger)

translations.english: Excuse me, could you please help me?
translations.amharic: ይቅርታ፣ እባክዎ ሊረዱኝ ይችላሉ? (yiqirta, ibakwo lireduñ yichilalu?)
translations.tigrinya: ይቕረታ፣ በጃኹም ክትሕግዙኒ ትኽእሉ ዲኹም? (yiqreta, bejakum kitihgizuni tik'ilu dikum?)
translations.somali: Raali noqo, fadlan i caawin kartaa?
translations.arabic: عفواً، هل يمكنك مساعدتي من فضلك؟ ('afwan, hal yumkinuka musa'adati min fadlik?)
translations.french: Excusez-moi, pourriez-vous m'aider s'il vous plaît?

phrases.usage_notes: Polite way to ask for help from someone you don't know
phrases.cultural_notes: Always start with an apology/excuse me in most cultures

phrases.base_meaning: Can you help me? (casual, to friend)

translations.english: Hey, can you give me a hand?
translations.french: Hé, tu peux me donner un coup de main?

phrases.usage_notes: Casual way to ask a friend for help
phrases.cultural_notes: Friends are expected to help each other readily

phrases.usage_notes: Use in any emergency situation regardless of who is around
phrases.cultural_notes: Shout loudly to attract attention in emergencies

translations.somali: Aad ayaan ugu mahad celinayaa, mudane/marwo

phrases.usage_notes: Formal expression of gratitude to strangers or in professional settings
phrases.cultural_notes: Showing gratitude is highly valued in all East African cultures

phrases.usage_notes: Casual thanks to friends and people you know well
phrases.cultural_notes: Can be shortened among close friends

translations.english: Excuse me, could I have some water, please?
translations.amharic: ይቅርታ፣ እባክዎ ውሃ ማግኘት እችላለሁ? (yiqirta, ibakwo wiha maget ichilalewu?)
translations.tigrinya: ይቕረታ፣ በጃኹም ማይ ክረክብ እኽእል ድየ? (yiqreta, bejakum may kirekib ik'il diye?)
translations.somali: Raali noqo, fadlan biyo heli karaa?
translations.arabic: عفواً، هل يمكنني الحصول على ماء من فضلك؟ ('afwan, hal yumkinuni al-husul 'ala ma' min fadlik?)
translations.french: Excusez-moi, pourrais-je avoir de l'eau s'il vous plaît?

phrases.usage_notes: Polite way to request water in formal settings or from strangers
phrases.cultural_notes: Water is considered a basic right; most people will help

translations.english: Got any water? / Can I get some water?

phrases.usage_notes: Casual way to ask for water from friends or family

translations.english: Excuse me, where is the hospital, please?
translations.amharic: ይቅርታ፣ ሆስፒታሉ የት ነው እባክዎ? (yiqirta, hospitalu yet new ibakwo?)
translations.tigrinya: ይቕረታ፣ ሆስፒታል ኣበይ ኣሎ በጃኹም? (yiqreta, hospital abey alo bejakum?)
translations.somali: Raali noqo, isbitaalku xagee ku yaal fadlan?
translations.arabic: عفواً، أين المستشفى من فضلك؟ ('afwan, ayna al-mustashfa min fadlik?)
translations.french: Excusez-moi, où est l'hôpital s'il vous plaît?
translations.spanish: Disculpe, ¿dónde está el hospital por favor?

phrases.usage_notes: Polite way to ask for directions to hospital
phrases.cultural_notes: People will usually help with medical emergencies

translations.english: I'd like to order lunch, please
translations.amharic: እባክዎ ምሳ ማዘዝ እፈልጋለሁ (ibakwo misa mazez ifeliagalehu)
translations.tigrinya: በጃኹም ምሳሕ ክእዝዝ እደሊ (bejakum misah ki'iziz ideli)
translations.arabic: أريد طلب الغداء من فضلك (uridu talab al-ghada' min fadlik)
translations.swahili: Nataka kuagiza chakula cha mchana tafadhali
translations.french: Je voudrais commander le déjeuner s'il vous plaît
translations.spanish: Me gustaría pedir el almuerzo por favor

phrases.usage_notes: Standard phrase for ordering lunch at a restaurant
phrases.cultural_notes: Lunch is typically the main meal in many East African cultures
